Here's a paragraph about the significance of the Pythagorean Theorem in geometry:

The Pythagorean Theorem is a fundamental concept in geometry that has far-reaching implications and applications. This famous theorem, at the core establishes the relationship between the lengths of the sides of a right-angled triangle, I.e., the square of the length of the hypotenuse equals the sum of squares of the other two sides (a² + b² = c²). Its significance goes beyond being just an algebraic equation; it allows us to calculate distances and lengths between various points and lines within geometric constructs, for both uos, – and 3-dimensional problems. From construction and architecture to physics,. As well as engineering, that can help calculate the distances, these calculations rely upon it and it gives engineers accurate calculations. This, A major area of application, mathematics also plays prominently role trigonoemtry which heavily leans to solving triangular relationships.
